poem:
**The Balance She Promised**

The morning paper unfolds,
a delicate breeze of ink
bringing her symbol of equality,
a woman woven into the fabric of power.

Yet the scales tip,
heavy with the weight of tradition—
a balance not met,
a plea dismissed like leaves in wind.

Her dream, embroidering the daylight,
finds no anchor in the soil of old Europe.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The first female president of the EU executive, who was re-elected for a historic second term last month, is drawing up her team of commissioners. Akin to government ministers, these are senior". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
